revised_title: De Haas-van Alphen Measurements of Conduction Electron g-Factor in Noble Metals and Potassium
tldr: The authors developed a new technique to measure the conduction electron g-factor in noble metals and potassium using the de Haas-van Alphen effect. They studied the g-factor of the neck orbits in noble metals and found a large g-shift from the free electron value in potassium, which they attributed to many-body effects. This technique allowed them to determine the anisotropy of the local g-factor over the Fermi surface and provided a value for the Landau coefficient in potassium.
